title: Big Data for Mobility Tracking  Knowledge Extraction in Urban Areas
objective: Track&Know will research, develop and exploit a new software framework that aims at increasing the efficiency of Big Data applications in the transport, mobility, motor insurance and health sectors. Stemming from industrial cases, Track&Know will develop user friendly toolboxes that will be readily applicable in the addressed markets, and will be also investigated in additional domains through liaison activities with running ICT-15 Lighthouse projects. Track&Know integrates multidisciplinary research teams from Mobility Data management, Complex Event Recognition, Geospatial Modelling, Complex Network Analysis, Transportation Engineering and Visual Analytics to develop new models and applications. Track&Know recognizes that Big Data penetration is not adequately developed in niche markets outside the traditional verticals (e.g. Finance) and so the Track&Know Toolboxes will be demonstrated in three real-world Pilots using datasets from niche market scenarios to validate efficiency improvements. Performance and impact benchmarks are elaborated and will be documented during pilots deployment. The Track&Know consortium is composed by complementary partners, coming from addressed research, technological and commercial domains, that have a proven track record of high quality research capacity. Thus, the carefully structured workplan, embodies a holistic approach towards meeting the Track&Know objectives and delivering market-relevant outcomes of significant exploitation potential.
participants: UNIVERSITEIT HASSELT;UNIVERSITE PIERRE ET MARIE CURIE - PARIS 6;CELERITAS MEDICAL LTD;FRAUNHOFER GESELLSCHAFT ZUR FOERDERUNG DER ANGEWANDTEN FORSCHUNG E.V.;OCTO TELEMATICS SPA;SISTEMATICA SPA;UNIVERSITAT ZURICH;CONSIGLIO NAZIONALE DELLE RICERCHE;UNIVERSITY OF PIRAEUS RESEARCH CENTER;"NATIONAL CENTER FOR SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH ""DEMOKRITOS""";ZELITRON ANONIMI ETAIREIA SYSTIMATON EPIKOINONIAS AYTOMATISMON KAI EFARMOGI.
